fields.name: pedon_key
fields.comment: An integer number that uniquely identifies a particular pedon

fields.name: site_key
fields.comment: An integer number that uniquely identifies a particular site

fields.name: pedlabsampnum
fields.comment: An identifier for the pedon sample that is assigned by the Kellogg Soil Survey Laboratory. This identifier is used to link the morphological pedon description with the associated measured property values from the laboratory.

fields.name: pedoniid
fields.comment: An internal ID (integer) that is part (or all) of a key that uniquely identifies a NASIS pedon record. Also known as part (or all) of the "primary key". This value is managed by NASIS and cannot be edited.

fields.name: upedonid
fields.comment: A short label to help a user identify a particular pedon.

fields.name: country_key
fields.comment: A Foreign key for a Country  (integer) that is part (or all) of a key that uniquely identifies a record. Also known as part (or all) of the "primary key".

fields.name: state_key
fields.comment: A Foreign key for a State (integer)  that is part (or all) of a key that uniquely identifies a record. Also known as part (or all) of the "primary key".

fields.name: county_key
fields.comment: A Foreign key for a County (integer)  that is part (or all) of a key that uniquely identifies a record. Also known as part (or all) of the "primary key".

fields.name: ssa_key
fields.comment: A Foreign key for a Soil Survey Area (integer)  r) that is part (or all) of a key that uniquely identifies a record. Also known as part (or all) of the "primary key".

fields.name: npark_key
fields.comment: A Foreign key for a National Park (integer)  that is part (or all) of a key that uniquely identifies a record. Also known as part (or all) of the "primary key".

fields.name: nforest_key
fields.comment: A Foreign key for a National Forest (integer)  that is part (or all) of a key that uniquely identifies a record. Also known as part (or all) of the "primary key".

comment: This table is a linkage betwwen NASIS Pedon morphological and the Lab data. This table stores information about locations, layers or horizons of a pedon that has had samples submitted to the SSL at the National Soil Survey Center or one of the various laboratories at NCSS cooperating universities. Data is periodically transferred from the SSL database to this table.

fields.comment: An integer number that uniquely identifies a particular pedon

fields.comment: An identifier for the pedon sample that is assigned by the Kellogg Soil Survey Laboratory. This identifier is used to link the morphological pedon description with the associated measured property values from the laboratory.

comment: The LIMS Pedon table holds general information about the pedon. The pedon is associated with a site. The converse is not necessarily true.

fields.comment: A unique identifier number for the pedon assigned by the laboratory. This number is used to link the morphological pedon description with the associated measured property values from the laboratory.

fields.name: result_source_key
fields.comment: Foreign key to the pedon or layer table depending on the result_type

fields.name: prep_code
fields.comment: A character string containing the Soil Survey Laboratory code used to identify the type of sample preparation.

comment: This table contains the results of calculations using measured, estimated and default values.

fields.name: wmiid
fields.comment: A unique identifier that identifies a row in the table

fields.name: peiid
fields.comment: An internal ID (integer) that is part (or all) of a key that uniquely identifies a NASIS pedon record. Also known as part (or all) of the "primary key". This value is managed by NASIS and cannot be edited.

comment: This table is used to develop a webmap which is used to interactive display of geographic information pertaining to laboratory information. The interactive map offers a national database of soil characterization data, allowing location of pedons spatially. Pedons are the smallest unit of soil containing all the soil horizons of a particular soil type. Clicking on a pedon location within the interactive map will enable users to access lab data about that pedon. View the new interactive map by clicking here offsite link image. You can also view the map on the Soil Lab Data Mart website (bottom left of page) here: https://ncsslabdatamart.sc.egov.usda.gov/.

fields.name: pedon_key
fields.comment: An integer number that uniquely identifies a particular pedon

fields.name: labsampnum
fields.comment: A unique identifier number for the pedon assigned by the laboratory. This number is used to link the morphological pedon description with the associated measured property values from the laboratory.

fields.name: project_key
fields.comment: An integer number that uniquely identifies a particular project

fields.name: site_key
fields.comment: An integer number that uniquely identifies a particular site

fields.name: layer_key
fields.comment: An integer number that uniquely identifies a particular layer

comment: The Layer table contains information about the layer, including the field identifier, horizon designation, reporting, and depths. Layer in the LIMS can be a true soil horizon or a reporting layer which does not correspond to the traditional soil horizon. The lay_rpt_seq_num sets the order of display for layer reports. The layer is the intended way analytical results are reported in the LIMS. New to the LIMS is the ability to allow stratified or vertically subdivided layers to be reported.

fields.name: site_key
fields.comment: An integer number that uniquely identifies a particular site

fields.name: usersiteid
fields.comment: A short label to help a user identify a particular site.

comment: The LIMS Site table holds the site (location) information about the place where the samples or pedon originated.

fields.name: prep_code
fields.comment: A character string containing the Soil Survey Laboratory code used to identify the type of sample preparation.

comment: The Optical Mineralogy glass count Count Data table holds the raw data for the sample. The table hold what type of optical count, the size fraction and replicate number.

comment: ROSETTA, which implements five hierarchical pedotransfer functions (PTFs) for the estimation of water retention, and the saturated and unsaturated hydraulic conductivity.

comment: The X-ray Diffraction Data table holds the raw data for the each mineral in the sample.

fields.name: area_key
fields.comment: An State internal ID (integer) that is part (or all) of a key that uniquely identifies a record. Also known as part (or all) of the "primary key".

comment: A lookup table containing the list of valid NRCS areas, both current and obsolete for Country, County, Soil Survey Area and MLRA. Note that a soil survey area code is a concatenation of a U.S. state FIPS code and a soil survey area number. Since this table is intended to record only U.S. and U.S. territory soil survey areas, every soil survey area code in this table should be unique.

fields.name: mcid
fields.comment: An internal ID (integer) that is part (or all) of a key that uniquely identifies a record. Also known as part (or all) of the "primary key".

fields.name: procedure_key
fields.comment: A non-connotative string of characters used to uniquely identify a record in the lab method code table

fields.name: proced_code
fields.comment: A character string containing the procedure code used to identify the type of sample preparation.

fields.name: source_system_key
fields.comment: Foreign key to the source system table. Defines the origin of the data.

comment: This table relates a non-connotative method code with the preparation, instrument, size fraction, analyte, procedure (if any) and calculation algorithm (if any) represented by that method code.

fields.name: apid
fields.comment: An internal ID (integer) that is part (or all) of a key that uniquely identifies a record. Also known as part (or all) of the "primary key".

fields.name: procedure_key
fields.comment: Foreign key to the source system table. Defines the origin of the data.

comment: The Analysis Procedure table is a lookup table which contains information about the analysiscprocedure. The analysis procedure is the basic analytical method applied to a prepared sample. This procedure may be applied to different sample preparations, but the default size-fraction is the most commonly used size-fraction. An analysis may have more than one procedure, one of which is chosen by the analyst to complete the analysis.

fields.name: analyte_key
fields.comment: A non-connotative string of characters used to uniquely identify a record in the Lab Analyte table.

fields.name: column_name
fields.comment: A character string containing the physical name of a column in the LIMS database.

comment: The Analyte table is a lookup table which contains information about an analyte (primary result of an analysis by a procedure). The LIMS uses this data to format the data, provide abbreviations and units of measure for reporting the data.
